result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Paul Thierfelder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of the action. 60 days to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

for DNA sample

Defendant Matthew Paul Thierfelder in court with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

One day trial, but behind 16-CF-77.

No violent contact with K.T.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.
Defendant appears voluntarily.

Defendant Matthew Paul Thierfelder in court with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions why defendant wasn't in court on 9/12/16. Atty Maciolek indicates there was some confusion between his office and defendant regarding notice being given to defendant. Atty Maciolek indicates he did not have that hearing on the his calendar, not sure what happened to the hearing notice. State concerned with explanation as he's never gotten a response from Atty Maciolek to his emails or text messages. State requests a $500 cash bond. Atty Maciolek gives argument. Court sets $250 cash bond. Same conditions apply. Court discusses pretrial issues with counsel. Atty Maciolek to disclose his witness list to the State by 9/20/16. Jury instructions to be filed by 9/30/16.

Attorney Lee Shuchart appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions where matter is at, indicates this matter is in the #2 position for trial.  Atty Shuchart asks that Atty Maciolek be allowed to be heard on State's motion to impeach. Court grants request, motion will be taken up before trial.  Court would like jury instructions/motions filed sooner than later.  State indicates DA Pelrine has attemped to contact Atty Maciolek with no response, would like Atty Maciolek to contact DA Pelrine to discuss issues before trial. Court encourages Atty Shuchart to convey message to Atty Maciolek. State concerned that defendant not present in court today, requests bench warrant but stay it for 48 hours. Court won't issue bench warrant but would like an explanation from Atty Maciolek within 48 hours as to why defendant wasn't in court today. Nothing further needed today.
